text: Lee Patrick Brown (born October 4, 1937) is an American criminologist, public administrator, politician and businessman. Stuart, Reginald. "Atlanta Commissioner gets police chief job in Houston." New York Times. March 10, 1982 Accessed January 13, 2013. In 1997 he was the first African-American to be elected mayor of Houston, Texas. He was reelected twice to serve the maximum of three terms from 1998 to 2004. From 1993 to 1996, Brown served as Director of the Office of National Drug Control Policy during the Bill Clinton administration. ==References== ==Other websites== * Brown, Lee and Jane Ely.
